page.title: 01Wormleighton General Review
page.content: The area around Wormleighton is largely farm land and this has been its purpose since the original Domesday Book. Three counties meet at a point named Three Shires marked by a stone. The counties being Northamptonshire, Warwickshire and Oxfordshire. The South Oxford Canal makes a couple of tortuous appearances in its Journey around Wormleighton hill. Also in the area are two sites of villages, outlines of which are visible with the naked eye but from the air these are very clear. Farming consists of grazing and crop growing all of which do well. There are two small sewage farms. The land is owned by Earl Spencer and is farmed by tenant farmers except for two farms owned privately.
